isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - CAB: 5000, 9100, 9200, 9300, 9400 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - CAB AIR SUSPENSION (5000 SERIES)

warning.para: For safety purposes the cab air suspension must be supplied from a pressure protected air supply.

svcprocinfo.para: Refer to Figure 86 for Items in parentheses.

The cab air suspension system for the 5000 Series contains two air springs (bags) (Item 1), two shock absorbers (Item 2), and is controlled by the height control valve (Item 3). The air suspension assembly needs no lubrication and very little maintenance.

The following components - air lines (Item 5), fittings (Item 4), air springs (Item 1), height control valve (Item 3), shock absorbers (Item 2) and lateral control arm (Item 22) - should be checked at the time the vehicle is being serviced. Immediate corrective action should be taken if a malfunction occurs.

note.para: The height control valve, air springs (bags) and shock absorbers are serviceable and can be replaced individually.

svcprocinfo.para: Periodically check tightness of all fasteners and connections. Refer to the Torque Chart for proper tightening of components.

svcsubproc.title: Height Control Valve - Remove

note.para: If there is an attempt to disassemble or adjust fittings on the height control valve ( Item 3, Figure 86), it will void the warranty. Contact the air suspension manufacturer for assistance.

step1.para: Drain the air from the air system.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from the air system, be sure the air system is drained and be sure to set the parking brake and/or block the vehicle to prevent the vehicle from moving while the service is being performed.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 87 for Items in parentheses.

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. AIR LINE COMPRESSION NUT (TIGHTEN HAND TIGHT + 1 TURN)

step1.para: Remove air line compression nuts (Item 4) and disconnect the air lines (Items 1 and 2) from height control valve (Item 3).
Disconnect the height control valve linkage (Item 5) from the height control valve arm (Item 6).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 86 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove height control valve (Item 3) by removing hex bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 6 and 12) securing the height control valve to the suspension crossmember bracket (Item 20). Remove the height control valve.
Position the height control valve in place on the suspension crossmember bracket and secure it with hex bolts and hex lock nuts. Tighten to 10 ft-lbs. (14 Nm).
Connect the height control valve linkage to the height control valve arm.
Connect the air supply air line and air spring air line to the height control valve and tighten the air line compression nuts. Refer to the TORQUE CHART for proper tightening of air line fittings.
Build up air pressure and check for air leaks.

Check cab height between the bottom of the left and right cab mount brackets and the top of the suspension crossmember mounting bracket. Cab air suspension ride height is 4-1/2 inches ( Figure 88). If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS, CAB AIR SUSPENSION (5000 SERIES).

figure.caption: Figure 88. Cab Air Suspension Ride Height

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber - Remove
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 86 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove shock absorbers (Item 2) by removing hex bolts and hex lock nuts (Items 7 and 14) at the top and bottom of the shock absorber.
Remove shock absorbers (Item 2) from between the left or right cab mount brackets (Items 18 and 19) and suspension crossmember bracket (Item 20).

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Suspension Shock Absorber - Install

step1.para: Position shock absorbers in place between the left or right cab mounting brackets and crossmember mounting bracket.
Install hex bolts and hex lock nuts at the top and bottom of the shock absorbers. Tighten to 45 ft-lbs. (61 Nm).

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Suspension Air Spring (Bag) - Remove

step1.para: Drain the air from the air system.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury, whenever any component is serviced or removed from the air system, be sure the air system is drained and be sure to set the parking brake and/or block the vehicle to prevent the vehicle from moving while the service is being performed.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 86 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove the air lines and air line fittings (Items 5 and 4) from the air springs (bags) (Item 1).
Remove the jam nut (Item 11) at the bottom of the air springs (bags) (Item 1).

Screw the air springs (bags) (Item 1) off the threaded studs on the left or right cab mount bracket (Item 18 or 19), then slide the air springs (bags) from between the left or right cab mount bracket and suspension crossmember bracket (Item 20).

svcsubproc.title: Cab Air Suspension Air Spring (Bag) - Install

step1.para: Place the air springs (bags) in position between the suspension crossmember bracket and left or right cab mount brackets.

Position the air springs (bags) at the threaded studs on the left or right cab mount brackets, then screw on until the top of the air springs (bags) is tight against the left or right cab mount brackets.
Install the jam nut at the bottom of the air springs (bags), securing the air springs (bags) to the suspension crossmember bracket. Refer to the TORQUE CHART.
Thread the air line fittings into the air springs (bags) and make sure they connect properly. Refer to the TORQUE CHART for proper tightening of air line fittings.
Install compression nut and air line into the elbow fitting at the bottom of the air spring (bag). Refer to the TORQUE CHART for proper tightening of air line fittings.
Build up air pressure and check for air spring operation. Also check for air leaks. Correct as necessary.

Check cab height between the bottom of the left and right cab mount brackets and the top of the suspension crossmember bracket. Cab air suspension ride height is 4-1/2 inches ( Figure 88). If adjustment is required, refer to ADJUSTMENTS, CAB AIR SUSPENSION (5000 SERIES).
